We explore the effect of applying the Fourier transform to the initial conditions.

Knowing only the endpoint Fourier-transformed state \\( \\hat{u}(k,T) \\) and that a speed change intervention occurred, can we determine the exact time or nature of the intervention, such as the new wave speed?

It does not, however, uniquely specify when or how the wave speed was changed, as multiple intervention scenarios could lead to similar endpoint states.
